page.title: 03A Visit to a Local Farm
page.content: Today Rachel,Matthew and I went to see Mr Kemp.We found out that he doesn't own the land,the Queen does, he just rents it.The land cover is dominantly wheat.He said he thinks the land is 858 acres.The cattle buildings take up three acres of the land.It takes about 4 to 5 months to sow the land.They keep about 150 cattle.The Kemps have been there from 1901 till 1985.They have sent a ton of corn to Ethiopia.They grow 6 different crops on their land.They dont have any other farms.Mr Kemp only owns 2 acres.The farm is called Patshull Home Farm.
